info: The fourth Development Policy Support Program (DPSP-4) is the fourth such operation in Indonesia. It is in substantive terms a continuation of DPSPs 1–3, the programmatic series of annual single-tranche operations from 2005 to 2007. The DPSP series—cofinancing the Development Policy Loan (DPL) series supported by the World Bank and the Government of Japan—is embedded in the Government’s Medium-Term National Development Plan (RPJM) for 2004–2009. It supports the RPJM’s broad goals of stimulating higher and sustainable economic growth with lower levels of unemployment and poverty, in three core areas: (i) investment climate, (ii) enhanced public financial management and governance, and (iii) public service delivery to the poor. The DPSP-4 is also proposed as a single-tranche operation based on completed actions demonstrating satisfactory progress. It builds on reforms undertaken during past DPSPs and sets the groundwork for an expanded policy dialogue for future operations.
name: FOURTH DEVELOPMENT POLICY SUPPORT PROGRAM
